screen_desc: The screenshot shows the Walmart.com webpage on a smartphone. The top of the screen displays the URL "walmart.com/cart," indicating the user is in the shopping cart section. Below the URL, there's a search bar allowing users to search for items on the Walmart site. The "Your recent searches" section lists previously searched items, including "rayovac triple a batteries," "jbl charge 4," and "razer blade 15." Below this, the "Trending" section shows trending search terms like "relish," "pizza rolls pepperoni," "pickled beets," and "drain."
action_think: The user wants to remove all items from the shopping cart, and then add a MacBook Air to it.
action_plan: Scroll to the bottom of the page to view all items in the cart.
Click on the 'Remove' button next to each item to clear the cart.
Scroll to view the search bar and input 'Macbook Air' to search for the product.
Click on the search result for the MacBook Air.
Add the MacBook Air to the cart by clicking on the 'Add to cart' or 'Buy Now' button.
Ensure all items have been cleared from the cart and the MacBook Air is added to the cart.
action_desc: scroll up to view all items in the cart
action_result: You have successfully searched for the phrase "macbook air" in the search bar. This action will bring up a list of results related to the term "macbook air". Now you can choose the desired product from the search results and add it to your cart. This action is making progress towards your user request.
